EncyclopediasOfCharacterTropes.description: A comprehensive guide to character archetypes and motifs in anime and manga.

tropes.name: Tsundere
tropes.description: Initially cold and even hostile towards another character but shows a warmer side over time.

tropes.name: Yandere
tropes.description: Character who is initially loving and gentle to someone they are very affectionate towards, but their devotion becomes destructive in nature, often through violence.

tropes.name: Kuudere
tropes.description: Appears cold and indifferent on the outside but is actually caring and soft-hearted on the inside.

examples.series: Rascal Does Not Dream of Bunny Girl Senpai

tropes.name: Dandere
tropes.description: Quiet, shy, and harmless character who becomes more talkative and expressive when around the right person.

tropes.name: Genki Girl
tropes.description: Energetic and cheerful, often providing the emotional support in the group.

tropes.name: Moe
tropes.description: Innocent and cute characters that are meant to evoke a protective instinct in the audience.

tropes.name: Bish≈çnen
tropes.description: Beautiful, often androgynous young men, designed to appeal to the aesthetic senses.

tropes.name: Bishojo
tropes.description: Young and pretty girls, often the central characters in romance plots.

tropes.name: Isekai Protagonist
tropes.description: Characters who are transported from the real world to a fantasy realm or parallel universe.

tropes.name: Mecha Pilot
tropes.description: Characters known for piloting giant robots or mechs, often in sci-fi settings.

tropes.name: Magical Girl
tropes.description: Girls who possess magical powers, often transforming to fight evil.

tropes.name: Chuunibyou
tropes.description: Characters who have delusional beliefs of grandeur or fantasy worlds, often acting as if they possess special powers or are involved in a grand narrative.

tropes.name: Senpai/Kohai
tropes.description: Characters involved in a senior-junior relationship, often explored in school or work settings.

tropes.name: Sensei
tropes.description: Teachers or mentors to the main characters, often providing guidance, training, or moral support.

tropes.name: Shonen Hero
tropes.description: Typically young male protagonists known for their courage, determination, and growth, often in action-packed narratives.

tropes.name: Shojo Heroine
tropes.description: Female protagonists in stories that focus on romance, personal growth, and emotions.
